issue.title: json upload does not upload authors
issue.body: I noticed that the meta data once uploaded to IPFS does not contain the list of author strings. @bhaney is this on the front end?

issue.title: pyXain improvements and features
issue.body:
Cleaning up pyXain so that the code is a bit less redundant, and adding in features such as preventing multiple initial submissions and submitting a copy of an earlier version is forbidden (by checking the SHA-3 hash of the to-be-submitted and previous versions. Testing has been improved, as the upload_file method has been moved out of pyXain.py and into node.py, as it will be easier to test there and is more of a server specific function as opposed to the arXain specifics.

Still to do:

- Allow for the un-pinning and removal of material (in case a mistake is found before submission)

issue.title: Meta data
issue.body: Adds the meta.json file to PaperSubmit and IPFS uploading. Right now only adds authors, title, abstract, and the contract address.

issue.title: Rename pdf
issue.body:
pyXain now renames the manuscript file to the contract hash before submitting to IPFS. This will make finding a paper on IPFS very easy with access to the blockchain. Upon finding a particular paper version's hash on the blockchain, one could acquire the pdf file and meta data by entering the following with an ipfs node running

```
http://localhost:8080/ipfs/<paper-hash>/meta.json
http://localhost:8080/ipfs/<paper-hash>/<contract-hash>.pdf
```

Ideally this would be `ipfs/paper-hash/v1/<contract-hash>.pdf` but there is a bug in the go-ipfs API preventing recursive adding of directories.

issue.title: Submit form integration with ipfs
issue.body:
Changed the Submit Paper page in order to integrate with IPFS API. It works well! I will add documentation soon about what has changed. 

To test out make sure everything is running and on the correct ports: TestRPC, Flask, and IPFS daemon.

If you use Chrome to test this out, take note that you will have to kill all of the cookies and saved data you have for MetaMask. I found out that if you restart a blockchain and MetaMask still has old transactions in its history, it will fail to create new contracts. Opening a window in incognito should help. You should see NO transaction history.

issue.title: Documentation updates
issue.body:
I have updated the landing page documentation to reflect a more standard Github project. In addition, I overhauled the CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md and the CONTRIBUTING.md documents. Nothing has been deleted, but I broke out our PennApps blurb and the How to Modify the site into their own documents. 

Before the merge of this pull request, I would like to get our license in here as well. I am leaning towards either a very neutral [MIT License](https://choosealicense.com/licenses/mit/) or one a bit more rigorous in regards to maintaining the open-source nature of alterations of this project [GNU GPL v3](https://choosealicense.com/licenses/gpl-3.0/).

issue.title: ipfs port name display fix
issue.body: Noticed the link displaying the IPFS hash was displaying the wrong port number, actually address worked fine though. Changes were made to PaperSubmit.vue and PaperStatus.vue.

issue.title: Pyxain testing
issue.body: Decided to use the pytest framework and added basic testing for pyXain. The contents are in pyXain/. Will make a decision with CI and coveralls when we switch over to the arXain organization.
